cheatsheetvideos.quote: Karla only needed to Study for 1 hour. She then went to the DMV and Passed her test
DMV Test Cheat Sheet: John Tells us How to Ace The Driver’s Test On your First Try

questions.question: Road rage and aggressive driving may be reduced by:
questions.explanation: As an increasing number of drivers populate the roadways, road rage becomes more prevalent. To help prevent road rage, a driver should use proper turn signals, obey posted speed limits, and allow plenty of travel time.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road is slippery when wet.

questions.question: On the freeway, you see a "Merging traffic“ sign. You should:
questions.answerB: Always remain at your present speed.
questions.answerC: Speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
questions.answerD: Move to another lane, if safe, to let traffic enter.
questions.explanation: When on a roadway with two or more lanes, you should make room for entering vehicles. If there is no one driving next to you, move over one lane.

questions.question: When you see this sign, it means:
questions.answerA: There is an object on the roadway.
questions.answerB: Traffic is coming from the right.
questions.answerC: The road is curving sharply to the left.
questions.answerD: There is a merge point ahead.
questions.explanation: Chevron signs like this indicate that the road curves sharply in the direction indicated by the chevron (in this case, to the left). There may be several chevron signs placed throughout a curve.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic ahead.

questions.question: If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
questions.explanation: Your horn should be used to warn other drivers or pedestrians in situations where they may not see you. For example, if you think another driver is about to hit you, you should sound your horn.

questions.question: You are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction. Your headlights:
questions.answerA: Should be on their high beam setting.
questions.answerB: Should be on their low beam setting.
questions.answerC: Should be off. Use your parking lights.
questions.answerD: May be on either their high or low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Do not use your high beam headlights when approaching or following another vehicle at night. Switch to the low beam setting to ensure the safety of everyone on the road.

questions.question: When approaching an accident scene, you should:
questions.answerA: Keep your attention on your driving.
questions.answerC: Stop if you are involved or if emergency help has not yet arrived.
questions.explanation: Do not stop at an accident scene unless you are involved or emergency help has not yet arrived. Keep your attention on your driving and keep moving, watching for people who might be on or near the road. Never drive to the scene of an accident, fire, or other disaster just to look.

questions.question: A license will be suspended if a driver:
questions.answerA: Refuses to submit to a chemical test.
questions.answerB: Drives 10 mph over the speed limit.
questions.answerC: Does not turn off their high beam lights around another vehicle.
questions.answerD: Sounds their horn in a residential area after midnight.
questions.explanation: If a driver is arrested for Operating a Vehicle While Impaired (OVI) but they refuse to take a chemical test when requested by an officer, their license may be suspended for one to five years. This suspension is in addition to any penalties that may occur if the driver is convicted of an OVI.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. The road splits into two one-way roadways separated by a median or divider. You must keep to the right.

questions.question: A red arrow displayed on a traffic light means that:
questions.answerA: A driver must proceed slowly through the intersection.
questions.answerB: A driver must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
questions.answerC: A driver must stop and then proceed when the signal changes to a green light or green arrow.
questions.answerD: A driver may turn in the direction that the red arrow is pointing.
questions.explanation: Unless a posted sign indicates otherwise, a traffic signal displaying a red arrow means that drivers must come to a full stop and remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
questions.answerC: You may proceed if the way is clear.
questions.answerD: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.explanation: If you drive past these signs, you are going the wrong way and are at risk of a head-on collision. You should cautiously turn around.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: A series of curves is ahead.
questions.answerD: The road will be slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that especially slippery conditions exist when the road is wet.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Parking spaces are reserved for people with disabled parking permits.
questions.answerC: Traffic in the lane must turn in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerD: Lanes are reserved for buses and vehicles with a driver and one or more passengers.
questions.explanation: This sign marks parking spaces that are reserved for people with disabled parking permits.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of the presence of a hill ahead.

questions.question: On a road which has no sidewalks, a pedestrian should walk on the:
questions.answerA: Side of the road which has the lightest traffic.
questions.answerB: Same side of the road on which traffic is moving.
questions.answerC: Side of the road facing oncoming traffic.
questions.answerD: Side of the road which has the heaviest traffic.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians should walk on the side of the road facing the traffic in the lane nearest them.

questions.question: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means that you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed with care.
questions.answerC: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
questions.answerD: Stop and proceed when the way is clear.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means "caution." If you approach such a light, slow down, look, and proceed with care.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns. Do not make a U-turn where this sign is posted.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident and another person is injured. You should:
questions.answerA: Moved the injured away from the scene immediately.
questions.answerB: Always leave the injured where they are.
questions.answerC: Not move the injured unnecessarily. Keep the injured warm and administer first aid.
questions.explanation: After an accident, do not move the injured unnecessarily. Unskilled handling can make serious injuries out of minor ones. Keep the injured warm until skilled help arrives. If there is severe bleeding, attempt to stop the flow of blood with direct pressure.

questions.question: If you’re going to turn left onto a one-way street, you should complete the turn into:
questions.answerB: The lane closest to your previous lane.
questions.explanation: You should always turn from the lane that is closest to the direction you want to go. Turn into the lane closest to your previous lane.

questions.question: A yellow and black diamond-shaped sign:
questions.answerA: Warns you about conditions on or near the road.
questions.answerB: Helps direct you to cities and towns ahead.
questions.answerC: Tells you about traffic laws and regulations.
questions.answerD: Tells you about road construction ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs, which tell you about conditions on or near the road ahead, are usually diamond-shaped with black symbols or words on a yellow background.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign is placed at the beginning of one-way streets and ramps to indicate that you must not continue driving in your current direction.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming traffic signal. They should be prepared to respond to a yellow light, red light, and/or cross traffic.

questions.question: When driving on slick roads, you should:
questions.answerA: Take turns more slowly than usual.
questions.explanation: While it is always dangerous to drive too fast on slippery roads, this is especially true when driving in turns and curves. Be sure to approach them more slowly in slippery conditions than you would under normal circumstances.

questions.question: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
questions.answerA: Passing on the left is permitted from either direction.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid line.
questions.answerD: Passing is not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that passing is allowed from the lane on the side next to the broken line.

questions.question: Distracted driving is:
questions.answerD: No less safe than driving under any other conditions.
questions.explanation: Distracted driving is extremely risky behavior that puts not only you and your passengers in danger, but also endangers pedestrians, bicyclists, and other motorists sharing the road. Focused attention on driving helps to prevent crashes.

questions.question: You come to an intersection with a flashing red light. You must:
questions.answerA: Slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
questions.answerB: Turn either right or left, since the road is blocked ahead.
questions.answerC: Stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
questions.answerD: Stop at the intersection, then proceed as traffic allows.
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means that you must come to a full stop, and then proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: When is it illegal to drive below the speed limit?
questions.answerA: When driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic
questions.answerB: When in heavy traffic in a construction zone
questions.answerC: Only when driving in rural areas.
questions.answerD: When driving under adverse weather conditions
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive so slowly that you disrupt the normal flow of traffic. You may receive a citation for driving too slowly.

questions.question: Larger vehicles have:
questions.answerD: The same blind spots as smaller vehicles.
questions.explanation: The larger the vehicle, the larger the blind spots. Large trucks and SUVs have spots close to their rears that cannot be seen in their side or rearview mirrors.

questions.question: When driving in traffic, it is safest to:
questions.answerA: Fluctuate your speed to keep alert.
questions.answerB: Drive faster than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerC: Drive slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerD: Drive with the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Crashes often happen when some drivers go faster or slower than other vehicles on the road. Always try to drive with the flow of traffic, within the posted speed limit.

questions.question: You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
questions.answerB: Speed up and pass in front of the pedestrians.
questions.answerC: Stop to let the pedestrians cross safely.
questions.answerD: Drive close to the pedestrians and frighten them so they’ll think twice before crossing against a red light.
questions.explanation: Yield to pedestrians and cars that may be caught in an intersection when you have a green light. Be careful around pedestrians under every circumstance.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you must:
questions.answerA: Stop completely and check for pedestrians and cross traffic.
questions.answerB: Slow down without coming to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Stop completely and wait for a green light.
questions.answerD: Slow down and check for traffic.
questions.explanation: Any eight-sided sign is a stop sign. At an intersection with a stop sign, you must stop completely and check for pedestrians and cross traffic in the intersection. Wait for the intersection to clear before proceeding.

questions.question: When you see other drivers around you acting or reacting in anger:
questions.explanation: When other drivers are behaving angrily, you should take action to physically and mentally distance yourself from the situation. Avoid making eye contact with them, or making body movements or gestures that could provoke them. Slow down, move over, or do whatever you safely can to put yourself out of danger.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You must drive slowly and sound your horn.
questions.answerC: You are entering a school's parking lot.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a school zone and that they should slow down and watch for children.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You must turn left or right.
questions.answerB: You are approaching a T intersection.
questions.answerC: The road that you are on intersects with a divided highway.
questions.answerD: You are on an overpass above a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road that you are on intersects with a divided highway. A divided highway is two one-way roadways separated by a median or guide rail.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a school crossing is ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you must keep to the right of the upcoming divider.

questions.question: Which of the following are used on some highways to direct drivers into the proper lanes for turning?
questions.answerC: White lines on the side of the road
questions.answerD: White arrows in the middle of the lanes
questions.explanation: Arrows may be used to indicate which lanes should be used for specific purposes, such as driving straight or making a turn.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: The road ahead turns sharply right, then left.
questions.answerB: The road ahead turns sharply left, then right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead curves to the left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead will turn sharply to the right and then to the left.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: The left lane is reserved for vehicles with a specific number of occupants.
questions.answerB: Specific turning movements are allowed from specific lanes.
questions.answerD: Drivers in both lanes are responsible for merging smoothly.
questions.explanation: This sign marks a high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lane. HOV lanes are reserved for use by buses and vehicles with a driver and one or more passengers, as indicated on the sign.

questions.question: When you see or hear an emergency vehicle coming, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately and let the vehicle pass.
questions.answerB: Drive as far toward the right side of the road as is safe and stop.
questions.answerC: Proceed slowly and permit the vehicle to pass.
questions.answerD: Keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: When driving on a two-lane roadway or undivided highway, you must yield to an emergency vehicle using its lights and/or siren, regardless of the direction from which it is approaching. Immediately drive as near as possible to the right side of the road and stop, taking care not to stop within an intersection.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This signs warns that a four-way intersection is ahead.

questions.question: Certain highway signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Such signs are known as:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Failure to comply is subject to penalty.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that drivers are approaching a steep hill and should prepare to adjust their speeds to continue to drive safely.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: All traffic must go straight ahead.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection ahead. A road joins from the right.

questions.question: You want to back out of your driveway. You see children playing nearby. Before you start to move your car, you should:
questions.answerA: Rev your engine to warn the children that you are moving.
questions.answerB: Sound your horn so the children will hear you.
questions.answerC: Walk to the back of the car to be sure the way is clear.
questions.answerD: Tell the children to stay away from the driveway.
questions.explanation: When you back up a vehicle, look through your back window for pedestrians and other obstacles. Do not rely only on your mirrors, especially when children are near. Before you back into or out of a driveway, get out of the vehicle and check behind your vehicle.

questions.question: Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
questions.answerD: Early enough for others to know your plans.
questions.explanation: Before passing, you should signal early enough for other drivers to know your plans in advance.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You must travel at the speed indicated.
questions.answerB: The maximum legal speed on the roadway is 55 mph.
questions.answerC: You must travel through the intersection at the posted speed.
questions.explanation: This is a speed limit sign. It indicates the maximum legal speed that you may drive on the road where it is posted. At times of rain, snow, ice, or other less-than-ideal conditions, you may have to drive more slowly than the posted limit.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: A road joins from the right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead turns sharply right, then sharply left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead turns sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

questions.question: Vehicle stopping distances never depend on:
questions.answerC: The condition of your vehicle's brakes.
questions.answerD: The condition and type of your vehicle's tires.
questions.explanation: The distance that a vehicle needs to stop depends on the motorist's reaction time, weather and visibility conditions, the vehicle's weight, the conditions of the vehicle's brakes, the condition and type of the vehicle's tires, roadway conditions, and speed.

questions.question: This is a ____ sign.
questions.explanation: This triangular sign is a "Yield" sign. When you see this sign, you must slow down to check for traffic and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and approaching cross traffic. Stop only if it is necessary to do so.

questions.question: A leaky exhaust system in your vehicle is dangerous because it can cause:
questions.explanation: The exhaust system carries exhaust gas out of the vehicle and prevents fumes from entering into the passenger compartment. To prevent carbon monoxide poisoning, keep your exhaust system free of leaks. Replace all defective parts immediately.

questions.question: When entering a street from a driveway, you:
questions.answerA: Must drive slowly to allow approaching vehicles and pedestrians time to get out of your way.
questions.answerB: Must honk your horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians know to give you room.
questions.answerC: Must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
questions.answerD: Can disregard any pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
questions.explanation: Always stop before entering the roadway from a driveway and yield to any approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. The stop should be made before crossing the sidewalk area. Failure to stop is unlawful.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
questions.answerD: Be alert for construction workers on the road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates the presence of a pedestrian crossing. Drivers should be cautious when driving where pedestrians may be present.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line next to your lane means that passing is not permitted from your direction.

questions.question: A driver under the age of 21 can be charged with Operating a Vehicle After Underage Consumption if they drive with a minimum blood alcohol content (BAC) of:
questions.explanation: A driver under the age of 21 can be charged with Operating a Vehicle After Underage Consumption if they drive with a minimum blood alcohol content (BAC) between 0.02  and 0.08 percent. This can result in license suspension for between 60 days and two years.

questions.question: To prepare for anything coming up on the road ahead, you should:
questions.answerA: Continually scan the entire road and all roadsides.
questions.answerB: Stare straight ahead at all times.
questions.answerC: Drive with your left foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
questions.answerD: Maintain focus toward the middle of the road.
questions.explanation: Your ability to handle dangerous traffic situations depends largely on searching for and identifying problems before meeting them. Looking far ahead of your vehicle does not mean you should simply stare at the center of the road. You need to continually scan the entire road, including the sides of the road.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: The overpass ahead has a low clearance.
questions.answerD: Two lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions are about to merge.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the overpass ahead has a low clearance. Do not proceed if your vehicle is taller than the height indicated (in this case, 13 feet, 6 inches).

questions.question: If worried, nervous, angry, or crying, a driver:
questions.answerA: Will drive no differently than they would if they were thinking more clearly.
questions.answerB: Can drive faster because they are more in touch with their senses.
questions.answerC: Should take the time to focus on driving before starting the engine.
questions.answerD: Should call a friend to vent while driving.
questions.explanation: You may not be able to drive well if you are worried, excited, crying, angry, or depressed. Emotions can distract you from your driving because your mind is focused on something else. Take time to calm down and get focused before driving.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a traffic signal is ahead.

questions.question: Where is parking prohibited?
questions.explanation: Drivers should not park on top of a crosswalk, on a highway bridge, or in a tunnel. Drivers should only park where it is legal to do so and where other drivers can clearly see their stopped vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Fines double in a work zone.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching an area with low clearance.

questions.question: This road sign indicates:
questions.answerA: The maximum safe speed for a residential area.
questions.answerB: The maximum safe speed for an expressway exit.
questions.answerC: The maximum safe speed for an expressway entrance.
questions.answerD: The maximum safe speed for a work zone.
questions.explanation: This advisory speed sign indicates the maximum safe speed for a highway exit (in this example, 30 mph).

questions.question: If you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
questions.answerB: Lock the ignition and remove the key.
questions.explanation: When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must stop the engine, lock the ignition, remove the key from the ignition, and set the parking brake.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they may encounter traffic coming from the opposite direction.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that deer cross the roadway in the area. You should slow down, be alert, and be ready to stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerD: Sharp right turn in the road ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a sharp right turn ahead.

questions.question: When approaching a flashing red traffic light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Drive through the intersection if there is no crossing traffic.
questions.answerB: Continue driving, as they have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Stop if a police officer is nearby.
questions.answerD: Treat the light like a stop sign.
questions.explanation: Flashing red lights are used at dangerous intersections. Treat them like stop signs.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic signal at an intersection has the same requirements as:
questions.explanation: When approaching a flashing red signal, you must stop and yield to all traffic that does not have to stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a flagger ahead controlling traffic in a construction area.

questions.question: In bad weather, increase your following distance to:
questions.explanation: The more distance between your vehicle and others, the more time you have to react to their actions. Keep a minimum following distance of four or five seconds during poor weather and traffic conditions.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign:
questions.answerA: Warns of existing or possible hazards.
questions.answerC: Alerts drivers to public recreation areas.
questions.answerD: Alerts drivers to upcoming food and gas locations.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs warn drivers of existing or potential driving hazards. You will usually see these signs in yellow or orange.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are approaching a winding road and that they should adjust their speed accordingly.

questions.question: During normal weather and traffic conditions, keep a minimum following distance of:
questions.explanation: The more distance between your vehicle and others, the more time you have to react. Keep a minimum following distance of three seconds during normal weather and traffic conditions. Increase your following distance during unusual weather or traffic conditions.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates the presence of a pedestrian crossing. You should watch for people entering a crosswalk or crossing your path. Slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign indicates that parking is not permitted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A regulatory sign displaying a red circle with a red slash through the middle indicates that a specific action is prohibited. Right turns are not permitted where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Motorcycles are entitled to:
questions.answerB: The same full lane width as other motor vehicles.
questions.answerC: Half the width of a lane.
questions.explanation: Lane usage for the motorcyclist is critical. Motorcycles are entitled to the same full lane width as all other vehicles.

questions.question: Guide signs are ____ signs that provide directional and mileage information to drivers.
questions.explanation: Guide signs, sometimes known as destination signs, have a green background and provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations. They can be a helpful resource when driving in unfamiliar locations.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that there is an upcoming stop sign and that they should prepare to come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching.
questions.answerB: Look both ways as you cross the intersection.
questions.answerC: Always come to a full stop at the intersection.
questions.answerD: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: Decrease your speed as you approach an intersection with a yield sign. Prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians in the intersection or crossroad. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign if traffic conditions require it.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way.
questions.answerC: Do not drive in this lane.
questions.answerD: Traffic turning left on the green light must yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.explanation: This sign is used with a traffic signal to tell drivers that left-turning traffic does not have the right-of-way and must instead wait for oncoming traffic to clear.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.answerD: Be ready to help children crossing the street.
questions.explanation: You must always yield to pedestrians who are in or about to enter a crosswalk. Be alert to pedestrians when driving across intersections or turning.

questions.question: When approaching a traffic signal displaying a flashing yellow arrow, drivers:
questions.answerA: Should merge into a lane in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerB: Should come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: May turn left after yielding to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.answerD: Have the right-of-way and may expect oncoming traffic to stop for them.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow arrow indicates that left turns are allowed in the direction of the arrow. However, the oncoming traffic has a green light and you must yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: You may drive around or under a gate that is being lowered or raised at a railroad crossing:
questions.answerA: As long as an approaching train is not too close.
questions.answerB: If your vehicle can do so without damaging the gate.
questions.answerC: If you first look carefully in both directions.
questions.explanation: Flashing red lights, lowered crossing gates, and/or bells at a railroad crossing mean that you must come to a complete stop. You must not go across the tracks until the lights and bells have stopped and the crossing gates are completely up. Do not drive around or under a gate that is moving up or down.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a steep hill ahead.

questions.question: You should signal to turn ____ before beginning your turn.
questions.explanation: When you wish to change lanes or make a turn, signal to inform other motorists of your intention. Signals should be activated at least 100 feet before you make the turn. Continue signaling until you have completed the turn or lane change.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are normally diamond-shaped and yellow, although orange warning signs are used in work areas. Such signs warn that you are approaching a hazardous location or an area where special rules apply.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a roundabout is ahead. Enter a roundabout at a low speed and yield to existing traffic.

questions.question: This sign means that:
questions.answerA: A community service group is picking up trash along the highway ahead.
questions.answerB: Workers are on or very close to the road in the work zone ahead.
questions.answerD: There is a pedestrian crosswalk ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that workers may be on or very close to the roadway ahead, so you should take special care when traveling through the area.

questions.question: A single broken yellow line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Dashed lines indicate that drivers directly next to the line are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign means that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: The most common color of warning signs is:
questions.explanation: Most warning signs are diamond-shaped and yellow with black markings. These signs warn drivers about unexpected conditions that may not be readily apparent.

questions.question: If you are driving on a one-way street and an emergency vehicle using its flashing lights approaches your vehicle, you must:
questions.answerA: Drive with your flashers turned on.
questions.answerB: Drive toward the nearest roadside and stop.
questions.answerC: Speed up and take the nearest exit.
questions.answerD: Slow down until the vehicle passes you.
questions.explanation: If an emergency vehicle using its lights or siren approaches while you are driving on a one-way street, you must drive toward the nearest roadside and stop.

questions.question: When two vehicles arrive to an intersection at the same time, which one has the right-of-way when no signs or signals indicate rules?
questions.answerA: The car approaching from the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The car approaching from the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: The car in which the driver sounds his horn first has the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: The car that is traveling the fastest has the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: At an intersection of two similar roads without a traffic control device, a driver must yield to a vehicle approaching from the right.

questions.question: Is it legal cross a double solid yellow centerline to pass?
questions.answerC: If there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerD: If the vehicle ahead of you is driving under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Two solid yellow lines down the center of a two-way road mean that neither lane of traffic may cross the lines, unless they are turning off of the roadway. A driver can cross double yellow lines when turning into or out of a driveway or entrance to a business. No passing is allowed over a solid yellow line.

questions.question: A red flashing traffic light has the same meaning as a:
questions.explanation: A red flashing traffic signal has the same meaning as a stop sign. When approaching a red flashing signal, come to a complete stop and proceed when it is safe to do so. A stop sign may sometimes also be posted where this signal is located.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light indicates that you should drive with caution.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates a low ground railroad crossing. Where this sign is present, railroad tracks cross the road at a steep slope and the bottom of low vehicles may drag or get caught on the tracks.

questions.question: When may you pass on the right shoulder of the road?
questions.answerA: When the car in front of you is turning.
questions.answerB: When the car in front of you is driving too slowly.
questions.answerC: When you don't see any pedestrians.
questions.explanation: If you pass on the right, do so only when conditions permit you to do so safely. Under no circumstances are you allowed to drive off the pavement or onto the shoulder.

questions.question: A speed limit is:
questions.answerA: The maximum or minimum legal speed you can travel on a road under dangerous conditions.
questions.answerB: The maximum or minimum legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions.
questions.answerC: The suggested speed to travel on a road under ideal conditions.
questions.explanation: A speed limit is the maximum or minimum legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions. You may drive more slowly than the posted speed, but it is illegal to drive any faster. You must drive more slowly where signs or signs indicate a school zone or work zone speed limit. If conditions such as road construction or bad weather make the posted speed unsafe, drive under the speed limit.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of the presence of a crossroad ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be aware of potential traffic entering from an upcoming side road.

questions.question: When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
questions.answerA: Use your bright lights until the other vehicle dims theirs.
questions.answerB: Flash your lights on and off to warn the other driver.
questions.answerC: Dim your lights and then speed up to pass quickly.
questions.answerD: Look toward the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: If a vehicle comes toward you with its high beams on, look away from the headlights and toward the right side of the road until the car has passed. This will keep you from being blinded.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:
questions.answerC: An upcoming curve in the road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead curves to the right.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerC: You may drive in the left lane.
questions.explanation: This is a "Keep right" sign. It indicates that a traffic island, median, or barrier is ahead and that drivers must keep to the right of it.

questions.question: What does a single dashed yellow line separating traffic mean?
questions.answerA: Drivers may pass if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerB: Both lanes travel in the same direction.
questions.answerD: Drivers may pass, even if it could be dangerous.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions. A single dashed yellow line in the center of a road indicates that vehicles traveling in both directions are permitted to pass. Drivers may only begin a pass if they will not interfere with any oncoming traffic.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign means that you are approaching an upcoming intersection. Watch carefully for cross traffic.

questions.question: What are the colors of warning signs indicating upcoming hazards?
questions.answerA: Black letters or symbols on a white background
questions.answerB: Black letters or symbols on a yellow background
questions.answerC: White letters or symbols on a blue background
questions.answerD: White letters or symbols on a green background
questions.explanation: Warning signs that indicate approaching hazards are usually yellow with black lettering or symbols. Warning signs in work zones are orange with black lettering or symbols.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign means that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: You need to use extra caution when driving near a pedestrian using a white cane because:
questions.answerB: He or she is a police officer.
questions.answerD: He or she has poor balance.
questions.explanation: When driving near a blind pedestrian who is carrying a white cane or walking with a guide dog, you must slow down, yield the right-of-way, and then proceed with caution. Be prepared to stop your vehicle in order to prevent injury or danger to the pedestrian.

questions.question: When a stop is required at an intersection and no markings appear to indicate a stop line or crosswalk, a driver:
questions.answerB: Is required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
questions.answerC: Should stop only at a place where they can see at least 200 feet on either side, even if they have to enter the intersecting roadway.
questions.answerD: Should stop where they have a clear view of approaching traffic before they enter the intersecting roadway.
questions.explanation: If there is no stop line or crosswalk, you should stop at the point nearest to the intersecting roadway where you can get a view of approaching traffic. You should not enter the intersecting roadway to gain a better view.

questions.question: The sign with this shape and color is a ____ sign.
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped warning signs like this are only used to indicate a no passing zone.

questions.question: When traveling on a multilane roadway with traffic moving in opposite directions, how should drivers use the shared center lane?
questions.answerB: To slow down or stop before turning left.
questions.answerC: As a through-traffic lane when traffic is moving too slowly.
questions.explanation: The only time a vehicle should enter the center lane is at a point where the vehicle will have time to slow down or stop in order to make a safe left turn maneuver. The center lane should never be used as a passing lane or as a through-traffic lane.

questions.question: If you miss your exit on an interstate expressway:
questions.answerB: Get off at the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
questions.answerC: Roll down your window and ask the driver next to you for help.
questions.explanation: If you miss your turn or exit, do not back up or try to turn around on the highway. Go to the next exit and safely turn around.

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on freeways with paved shoulders is:
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on freeways with paved shoulders is 65 mph. If a different speed limit is posted, you should follow that speed limit.

questions.question: Passing is prohibited:
questions.explanation: Locations where it is unlawful and unsafe to pass another vehicle include hills, curves, intersections, and railroad crossings.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.

questions.question: What is the meaning of this sign?
questions.answerA: The traffic signal ahead is displaying a red light.
questions.answerB: The traffic signal ahead is broken.
questions.answerC: The traffic signal ahead is displaying a green light.
questions.answerD: There is a traffic signal ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a traffic signal at the intersection ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Don't drink if you are going to drive.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road is slippery when wet.

questions.question: This sign tells you that:
questions.answerA: No turns are allowed on this road.
questions.answerC: There are a series of curves ahead.
questions.answerD: The road may be slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of an upcoming winding road with three or more curves.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Drive with caution and be ready to slow down.
questions.answerB: Do not drive in this lane.
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop and yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: Slow down, be prepared to stop, and, if necessary, yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: This type of triangular sign means drivers must yield. You must slow down as you come to an intersection marked with this sign and be prepared to stop. Let any other vehicles, bicyclists, or pedestrians pass safely before you proceed.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Slow down and prepare to stop if cars are approaching you.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop and go when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping.
questions.answerD: Stop only for traffic on an intersecting road.
questions.explanation: A stop sign means that you must come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians in or heading toward the intersection. Go again when it is safe.

questions.question: Child restraints are required for:
questions.answerA: Infants and children who are under the age of four and/or weigh less than 40 pounds.
questions.answerB: All children if the driver of the car is their parent or guardian.
questions.answerC: All children who are seated in the front seat of a car.
questions.answerD: All children who are under the age of six when airbags are not available.
questions.explanation: Infants and children who are under the age of four and/or weigh less than 40 pounds must be properly restrained in an approved child safety seat. Any child who is at least four years of age but less than eight years of age must be properly restrained in a booster seat, unless they are 4’9” or taller.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This signs indicate that U-turns are prohibited in the location where it is posted.

questions.question: How can you lower the risk of hydroplaning?
questions.answerA: Do not speed when the roads are wet.
questions.answerB: Use tires with proper air pressure.
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning happens when a vehicle glides on top of a thin layer of water between its tires and the road. Tires with low air pressure or bad tread can increase the risk of hydroplaning. Speeding also increases the risk.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers:
questions.answerA: That the right lane ends and traffic should merge left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane on a multilane roadway ends ahead. Traffic in the right lane must merge left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are approaching a T intersection and should prepare to turn either right or left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.answerD: Don’t park on the right side of the street.
questions.explanation: A sign with a red circle and slash over a symbol indicates that the action represented by the symbol (in this example, a right turn) is not allowed.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Turn right after making a complete stop.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs display laws that drivers must always obey. Right turns are not permitted where this sign is present.

questions.question: A motorist must maintain a "safety zone" of at least ____ between their car and a motorcyclist.
questions.explanation: A motorist should leave a "safety zone" of at least three seconds between their car and a motorcyclist. The slightest contact between a car and a motorcycle can mean a spill or injury for the rider.

questions.question: The driver's left arm and hand are extended upward. This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
questions.explanation: If a driver's left arm and hand are extended upward, they are indicating that they intend to turn right. Adjust your driving accordingly if following a driver who is using this hand signal.

questions.question: When encountering an aggressive driver, you should:
questions.answerA: Avoid eye contact, slow down, and let them pass.
questions.answerB: Cut them off to slow them down.
questions.answerD: Make sure they know you disapprove of their behavior.
questions.explanation: If another driver is threatening you or intentionally driving dangerously around you, remain calm and try to put as much distance between the two of you as possible. Slow down and let them pass. Do not make eye contact and do not make obscene gestures.

questions.question: An inattentive driver is a driver who:
questions.answerA: Stares at objects off the roadway or daydreams while driving.
questions.answerB: Maintains eye contact during a conversation with a passenger while driving.
questions.answerC: Only watches the vehicle ahead of their vehicle.
questions.explanation: Do not become distracted by looking at passengers, attempting to find something in your vehicle, looking at reading material, sightseeing, or daydreaming while driving. Continue scanning the road, checking your mirrors, and looking at the instrument panel at regular intervals. Developing these safe habits will keep you attentive as a driver.

questions.question: A bicyclist who doesn’t obey traffic laws:
questions.answerA: Is in the right because bicyclists don’t have to obey traffic laws.
questions.answerC: Will always receive a warning from law enforcement.
questions.explanation: All bicyclists have the same rights, duties, and responsibilities as drivers of motor vehicles. Motorists and bicyclists who do not obey traffic laws can be ticketed.

questions.question: Fog can greatly reduce the visibility of other vehicles, pedestrians, and traffic signals. When driving in fog, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive cautiously and reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: Not use your high beam headlights.
questions.answerC: Use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road and objects.
questions.explanation: Fog can greatly reduce your ability to see other vehicles, pedestrians, and traffic signals. When driving in fog, drive cautiously and at reduced speeds. Do not use high beam headlights. Low beams better illuminate the road and objects ahead in foggy conditions.

questions.question: Texting while driving is:
questions.answerD: Legal if the driver is using voice-to-text technology.
questions.explanation: In the state of Ohio, drivers are not permitted to text while operating a vehicle. Texting while driving is a dangerous activity and can lead to fines and license suspension.

questions.question: When approaching railroad tracks, you should:
questions.answerA: Look, listen, slow down, and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerB: Speed up to cross the tracks before the gate is lowered.
questions.answerC: Try to drive around a lowered gate.
questions.answerD: Not pay attention to how many tracks there are to cross.
questions.explanation: When approaching railroad tracks, you should look, listen, slow down, and be prepared to stop for trains or other vehicles that may be using the rails.

questions.question: If a green arrow turns into a solid green light, you:
questions.answerA: May still turn, but you must yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: May no longer turn and must proceed straight.
questions.answerC: Still have the right-of-way to turn.
questions.answerD: No longer have to turn in the direction that the arrow indicated.
questions.explanation: If a green arrow turns into a solid green light, you may still turn in the direction that the arrow was pointing but you must first yield to pedestrians and oncoming traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This sign tells drivers the direction in which they must drive when turning onto a one-way street.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a steep downhill grade is ahead.

questions.question: The speed limit in school zones is:
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, drivers in school zones should not drive faster than 20 mph. You should always use caution when driving in a school zone.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Fines double in a work zone.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to potential bicycle cross traffic.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway divided by two solid yellow lines. You may:
questions.answerA: Cross these lines only to make a left turn into or from an alley, private road, or driveway.
questions.answerB: Cross these lines to pass other vehicles, but only if there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerC: Cross these lines under no circumstances.
questions.answerD: Cross these lines only to make a U-turn.
questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines are used to mark roadways where passing is prohibited from both directions. You may cross these lines only to make a left turn into or from an alley, private road, or driveway.

questions.question: Driving while keeping your pet on your lap is:
questions.answerB: Legal if the animal is asleep.
questions.explanation: Operating a vehicle while holding an animal on your lap can be both dangerous and illegal. If you commit a moving violation while participating in a distracting activity, such as holding an animal or using a handheld cell phone, you may be charged for distracted driving in addition to any penalties for the moving violation.

questions.question: When you see this black and yellow sign, it means:
questions.answerA: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only.
questions.answerB: That due to upcoming roadwork, there is a detour to the right.
questions.answerC: Slow down because the road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle.
questions.answerD: There is a crossroad to your right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle (in this case, to the right). Before you reach such an extreme curve, you should slow down as much as you would when making a turn at an intersection.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: The road ahead is closed to traffic.
questions.answerD: The highway ahead is undergoing maintenance.
questions.explanation: Construction and maintenance signs are orange-colored and are used to notify drivers of unusual or potentially dangerous conditions in or near work areas. This sign warns drivers that they are approaching a construction zone and that they should prepare to lower their speed and drive with extraordinary caution.

questions.question: When is street racing acceptable?
questions.explanation: Street racing, also known as drag racing, is illegal and can result in serious injuries or fatalities. Illegal street racers put other drivers at risk because races are typically held on public roads. Due to the high speeds, drivers are unable to react to common road hazards or other driving situations, which often results in crashes.

questions.question: You may turn right on red:
questions.answerA: When there is a sign prohibiting turning right on red.
questions.answerB: Before pedestrians have crossed any intersecting crosswalks.
questions.answerC: Before coming to a complete stop.
questions.answerD: After coming to a complete stop and yielding to pedestrians and vehicles in the intersection.
questions.explanation: If you are turning right, you may turn on a red light after coming to a full stop. You may only turn if it is safe to do so and if there is no sign prohibiting the turn on a red light. Be careful of pedestrians crossing in front of your vehicle.

questions.question: A “No stopping” sign means that, unless directed to do so by a police officer, you may stop only:
questions.answerB: To avoid conflict with other traffic.
questions.explanation: A "No stopping" sign means you can only stop to obey a traffic signal, to obey a police officer, or to prevent a conflict with another vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited. Do not make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Traffic signs with three sides of equal length warn drivers to slow down when approaching an intersection and to be prepared to come to a complete stop to yield to other drivers or pedestrians. Drivers may proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When parking uphill on a hill or incline with a curb:
questions.answerA: Turn your front wheels sharply toward the curb.
questions.answerB: Turn your front wheels slightly to the right.
questions.answerC: Turn your front wheels sharply away from the curb.
questions.explanation: To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked facing uphill, turn your front wheels sharply away from the curb. If you are parking uphill on a street that has no curb, turn the wheels sharply toward the edge of the road.

questions.question: If you are following a school bus or tank truck, you should:
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop at all railroad crossings.
questions.explanation: School buses and tank trucks carrying flammable liquids must stop at railroad crossings. Be prepared to stop if following one of these vehicles.

questions.question: When is a driver permitted to turn right on a red traffic signal?
questions.answerA: When the driver has stopped and verified that the turn will not interfere with crossing traffic.
questions.answerB: When signs are clearly posted to allow a right turn on red.
questions.answerC: Only at the direction of a police officer.
questions.answerD: After first slowing and verifying the turn will not interfere with other traffic and pedestrians.
questions.explanation: In Ohio, it is legal to turn right after stopping at a red traffic signal, provided that a driver first comes to a complete stop and makes sure the turn will not interfere with crossing traffic or pedestrians. Drivers should only turn right on a red light when there is no sign posted forbidding right turns on red and they can clearly see that the turn can be completed safely.

questions.question: A red and white triangular sign at an intersection means:
questions.answerA: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching.
questions.answerB: Look both ways as you cross the intersection.
questions.answerC: Always come to a full stop at the intersection.
questions.answerD: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: A triangular red and white yield sign means that you must decrease speed as you approach an intersection and yield the right-of-way to any vehicles or pedestrians in the intersection. You must be prepared to stop if conditions require it.

questions.question: In general, when driving, you should drive:
questions.answerA: Faster than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerB: On the right half of the road.
questions.answerC: Slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerD: On the left half of the road.
questions.explanation: Generally, when driving on a road with two lanes moving in the same direction, you should drive on the right half of the road. Use the left lane to overtake and pass another driver, to make a left turn, or if otherwise instructed to do so by an officer or traffic signal. Vehicles driving more slowly than the flow of traffic should stay in the rightmost lane.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that the divided highway is about to end.

questions.question: The posted speed limit shows:
questions.answerB: The exact speed at which you must travel to avoid a ticket.
questions.answerC: The maximum safe driving speed under ideal road and weather conditions.
questions.answerD: The maximum safe driving speed under all road conditions.
questions.explanation: A speed limit sign shows the maximum legal driving speed for the stretch of highway where it is posted. Driving safely may require you to travel more slowly than the posted limit. When conditions are less than ideal, drivers should slow down.

questions.question: Consuming which of the following substances may impair your ability to drive safely and may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
questions.answerB: Controlled substances, such as illegal drugs or prescription medicines
questions.answerC: Inhalants, such as glue or paint
questions.explanation: A wide variety of intoxicants can impair your ability to drive. These include all types of alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, inhalants, and many legal medications (both prescription and over-the-counter).

questions.question: A work zone:
questions.answerB: Is marked with black and white signs.
questions.answerC: Does not require a driver to slow down and pay extra attention.
questions.explanation: Work zones are often stationary, but they may also be present in the form of moving vehicles striping lines, mowing, or removing snow. Work zones are marked by orange signs with black lettering or symbols. Slow down and pay extra attention when approaching or driving through a work zone.

questions.question: When passing an emergency vehicle stopped on the side of the road, drivers should:
questions.answerB: Vacate the lane closest to the emergency vehicle or slow down.
questions.answerC: Ask the emergency worker if they need help.
questions.answerD: Move to the lane closest to the stationary vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you are driving past an emergency vehicle parked on the side of the road, you must vacate the lane closest to the stationary emergency vehicle. If you cannot move over safely, you must slow down.

questions.question: ____ limit your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
questions.answerA: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit can
questions.answerC: Even the smallest amount of alcohol can
questions.answerD: Only a blood alcohol level greater than 0.05 percent can
questions.explanation: Even the smallest amount of alcohol will reduce your concentration, perception, judgment and memory, and your driving skills will suffer. No one can drink and drive safely.

questions.question: This green arrow on a lane use control signal means:
questions.answerB: No traffic is allowed in this lane.
questions.answerD: You must merge into this lane.
questions.explanation: A steady downward green arrow over a traffic lane means you may use the lane indicated.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane reduction; the right lane ends soon.
questions.answerD: Lane reduction; the left lane ends soon.
questions.explanation: This sign indicate that the right lane ends ahead.

questions.question: You may not pass other vehicles within ____ of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: Drivers should not pass other vehicles within 100 feet of a railroad crossing. Drivers should only pass where it is safe and legal to do so.

questions.question: Which of the following commonly causes traffic accidents?
questions.answerB: Excessive speed under the driving conditions
questions.explanation: Driving too fast for conditions is a major cause of motor vehicle crashes. Being inattentive to surroundings can cause a driver to collide with other vehicles. Most rear-end collisions are caused by drivers following other vehicles too closely.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Highway changes ahead and to the right.
questions.answerB: Hiking trails ahead and to the right.
questions.answerC: Hotel ahead and to the right.
questions.answerD: Hospital ahead and to the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that hospital emergency services are located to the right.

questions.question: Don’t follow other cars too closely because:
questions.answerA: You may not see the road between the cars.
questions.answerB: You may not have time to stop if the vehicle in front of you slows or stops suddenly.
questions.answerC: You may not see the vehicle's turn signals.
questions.answerD: You may not see the other vehicle’s brake lights.
questions.explanation: If you follow too closely and the vehicle in front of you slows or stops suddenly, you may not have enough time to avoid a collision.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: You must bear either right or left.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a Y intersection ahead. You must bear either to the right or to the left.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down and keep moving in your lane.
questions.answerC: Pull to the right curb and stop.
questions.explanation: When you see an emergency vehicle using its lights or hear it using its siren, you must immediately pull over to the curb or side of the road and stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerD: Construction workers on or near the roadway.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that there may be pedestrians crossing the road ahead.

questions.question: If you see this sign above your lane, you:
questions.answerB: May either continue through the interchange or exit the freeway from your current lane.
questions.answerC: May stay in your lane and continue through the interchange.
questions.answerD: Must exit the freeway, if you stay in your current lane.
questions.explanation: If a yellow panel with the message "Exit only" is on a highway sign, the lane below the sign will not continue through the interchange. Instead, the lane will go off of the roadway to form a ramp. If you are in a lane directly under an "Exit only" sign, you may change lanes to move through the interchange or you must exit the highway.

questions.question: If you see this sign, you:
questions.answerB: May pass a slow-moving vehicle if you can do so quickly.
questions.answerC: May pass if you know the road ahead.
questions.answerD: May pass, but only at night.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs are white, rectangular signs with black markings. Drivers must obey the instructions posted on all regulatory signs. Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited for drivers to pass one another.

questions.question: When driving under icy or snowy conditions, which driving technique will help drivers avoid crashes?
questions.answerA: Add extra weight to their vehicles to improve traction.
questions.answerB: Get off the highways as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Engage the four-wheel drive on their vehicles.
questions.answerD: Reduce their speed and increase their following distance.
questions.explanation: Reduce your speed when roads are snow-covered or icy. Doing this and increasing your following distance are the most important techniques for avoiding crashes under snowy or icy conditions.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming curve in the road.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign provides advance warning that bicycles may be present.

questions.question: At an intersection with a yield sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop before entering the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield just to the traffic on the right.
questions.answerC: Yield just to the traffic on the left.
questions.answerD: Slow down and yield the right-of-way to other traffic.
questions.explanation: A yield sign means that you must slow down and yield the right-of-way to traffic in the intersection or roadway you are entering.

questions.question: You may not pass other vehicles within ____ of a bridge, viaduct, or tunnel.
questions.explanation: Drivers may not pass other vehicles within 100 feet of a bridge, viaduct, tunnel, railroad crossing, or intersection. Drivers should only pass where they may legally and safely do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Eight-sided traffic signs warn drivers that they must stop and yield the appropriate right-of-way at an intersection. Drivers may proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: You are driving on the roadway and hear a siren behind you. You should:
questions.answerB: Pull over to the right and stop.
questions.answerC: Speed up to get out of the way.
questions.explanation: When you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle coming from behind your vehicle, you must create a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop. Reduce your speed and safely pull over to the side of the road. If the emergency vehicle is directly behind your vehicle when you are in heavy traffic, keep moving slowly until you can get out of its way.

questions.question: If you are approaching a school bus that has stopped to drop off children on a four-lane highway, you must come to a complete stop only if:
questions.answerA: You are traveling in the same direction as the bus.
questions.answerB: You can see children trying to cross the street.
questions.answerC: You are driving on the opposite side of the highway.
questions.answerD: The bus driver waves you ahead.
questions.explanation: If a school bus has stopped to drop off children on a roadway with four or more traffic lanes, only drivers on the same side of the roadway must come to a complete stop. Be especially cautious when driving near children.

questions.question: The most effective safety restraints in a traffic crash are:
questions.answerA: Only a lap and shoulder belt.
questions.answerC: Both a lap/shoulder belt and an airbag.
questions.explanation: Safety belts can double your chance of surviving a crash and more than double your chance of avoiding serious injury. Airbags, when used properly with safety belts, provide additional protection in a front-end crash. You should wear both shoulder and lap belts.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a T intersection is ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Circular traffic signs indicate upcoming railroad crossings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a railroad crossing and should be looking for signs of an oncoming train.

questions.question: The effect that alcohol has on your reflexes and judgment:
questions.answerA: Is less pronounced when consuming beer instead of wine.
questions.answerB: Is less pronounced when consuming wine instead of beer.
questions.answerC: Is most pronounced when consuming hard ciders and mixed drinks.
questions.answerD: Depends on the amount of alcohol in your bloodstream.
questions.explanation: Consuming any type of alcohol can have negative effects on your reflexes and judgment. It does not matter which type of alcohol is consumed, only how much alcohol has entered a person's bloodstream.

questions.question: What can you do to avoid the need to make emergency stops while driving in traffic?
questions.answerA: Honk your horn to make others aware of your presence.
questions.answerB: Look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
questions.answerC: Drive in the right lane only.
questions.answerD: Drive more slowly than the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Keeping a safe following distance will enable you to react to an upcoming problem without the need for a emergency stop, which could cause a driver behind you to crash into the back of your vehicle.

questions.question: If your turn signals fail, you should use ____ to indicate that you are turning.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle's turn signals do not work, you should use hand signals to indicate when you intend to change direction.

questions.question: On a two-lane street, your vehicle is being followed by a fire engine that is not using its emergency signals. You should:
questions.answerA: Continue to drive in a normal manner.
questions.answerB: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerC: Speed up to get out of its way.
questions.answerD: Slow down, move as far to the right as possible, and stop.
questions.explanation: If you are being followed by an emergency vehicle that is not using its siren or flashing lights, you do not need to clear a path. Continue driving in a normal manner.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: The road ahead curves right. Slow down to the safe speed indicated.
questions.answerB: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated.
questions.answerC: Merge. Slow down to the safe speed indicated.
questions.answerD: Winding road ahead. Slow down to the safe speed indicated.
questions.explanation: These signs indicate that the road curves to the right ahead and that drivers should slow down to the safe speed indicated (in this case, 35 mph).

questions.question: This sign indicates that:
questions.answerA: There is a steep hill ahead.
questions.answerB: No trucks are allowed on an upcoming hill.
questions.answerD: There are trucks on an upcoming hill.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a steep hill or downgrade ahead.

questions.question: Unless it is posted otherwise, the speed limit in a residential area is:
questions.explanation: In a residential area, the speed limit is 25 miles per hour, unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.answerD: Drive with caution and be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: An eight-sided sign always means "stop." You must come to a complete stop and wait for any vehicles or pedestrians to clear the way before proceeding.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be cautious when driving under conditions that may cause the roadway to become wet and slippery.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing that has no visible gates or flashing lights, but has a standard crossbuck. You should:
questions.answerA: Approach all tracks with extreme caution and cross only when you know that there is no train coming.
questions.answerB: Turn your radio down to hear if there may be an approaching train.
questions.answerC: Only continue once cleared to do so by a flagger, if applicable.
questions.explanation: You must approach all railroad crossings with extreme caution and cross only when you know that no train is coming from either direction. If there is a flagger at a crossing, you must obey all of their instructions.

questions.question: A “No standing” sign at a certain location means:
questions.answerA: You may never stop your vehicle there.
questions.answerB: You may park there if the driver remains in the vehicle.
questions.answerC: You may stop temporarily only to pickup or discharge passengers.
questions.answerD: You may stop to load or unload merchandise.
questions.explanation: A "No standing" sign means that you may only make a temporary stop to load or discharge passengers.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign warns drivers to be extra careful when the pavement is wet because the road may become slippery, making vehicles more difficult to control.

questions.question: A solid white line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines are used to separate traffic moving in the same direction. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerD: There is a traffic signal ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a traffic signal ahead.

questions.question: You should honk your horn when you:
questions.answerC: See a child who is about to run into the street.
questions.explanation: Your horn should be used as a warning in situations where you think another driver or a pedestrian does not see you. For example, if a child begins to run into the street in front of your vehicle, you should sound your horn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. They should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid brake damage or collision.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Trucks are permitted on an upcoming narrow bridge.
questions.answerB: The bridge ahead is open to one-way traffic only.
questions.answerC: The bridge ahead is wide enough for only one car at a time.
questions.answerD: The bridge ahead may be too narrow to meet or pass a truck.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that an upcoming bridge may be too narrow to meet or pass a truck and that they should be careful.

questions.question: This sign means:
