questions.explanation: The only way to avoid the risks of drinking and driving is to decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive. Because alcohol affects your judgement, it will be harder for you to make safe decisions after you have started drinking.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a traffic signal is ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerD: Construction workers on or near the roadway.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that there may be pedestrians crossing the road ahead.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
questions.explanation: This sign (with the arrow below) indicates the location of a bicycle crossing/path. Drive with caution around this sign because bicycles likely regularly cross or ride beside traffic in the area.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.

questions.question: A driver under the age of 21 can be charged with Operating a Vehicle After Underage Consumption if they drive with a minimum blood alcohol content (BAC) of:
questions.explanation: A driver under the age of 21 can be charged with Operating a Vehicle After Underage Consumption if they drive with a minimum blood alcohol content (BAC) between 0.02  and 0.08 percent. This can result in license suspension for between 60 days and two years.

questions.question: Which of the following recommendations does not promote safe night driving?
questions.answerB: Be aware that tinted windows reduce visibility in the dark.
questions.answerC: Carry a flashlight in your vehicle.
questions.answerD: Look into the headlights of oncoming vehicles.
questions.explanation: If you look into the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, the pupil of your eye will contract. After the oncoming vehicle has passed, there will be an interval of time during which the pupil must readjust to the less intense light. During this recovery period, you are virtually driving blind.

questions.question: After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children:
questions.answerA: Do not proceed until the children wave to you.
questions.answerB: Watch for children walking along the side of the road.
questions.explanation: After stopping for a school bus that has its stop arm extended and its lights flashing, watch for children walking along the side of the road. You should always drive with caution when driving near children.

questions.question: Your tire blows out while you are driving. You should:
questions.answerB: Hold your steering wheel tightly and slow to a stop.
questions.answerD: Turn on your emergency flashers and continue driving.
questions.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, do not immediately apply the brakes. Grip the steering wheel firmly and steer to remain in your traffic lane. Reduce your speed gradually by releasing the accelerator and staying off the brakes. Once you are moving very slowly, apply the brakes lightly and pull off the road into a safe area.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Fines double in a work zone.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to potential bicycle cross traffic.

questions.question: The best way to avoid hydroplaning is to:
questions.answerB: Slow down when roads are wet or slushy.
questions.answerC: Watch out for standing water or puddles.
questions.explanation: When roads are wet, cars take a longer distance to stop and may skid on quick turns. Do not use cruise control when driving under wet or icy conditions. Reduce your speed and drive with caution.

questions.question: A regulatory sign containing a red circle with a slash through the middle indicates:
questions.answerA: That drivers should come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: That some drivers should yield to other drivers.
questions.answerD: That drivers should drive under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Some regulatory signs prohibit certain actions. These signs are rectangular and white with red and black markings. A red circle and slash on top of a black symbol indicates that the specified action is forbidden.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.answerD: Drive with caution and be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: An eight-sided sign always means "stop." You must come to a complete stop and wait for any vehicles or pedestrians to clear the way before proceeding.

questions.question: When merging onto a freeway, it is usually best to:
questions.answerA: Proceed slowly while waiting for an opening.
questions.answerB: Accelerate to a speed that is faster than the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Turn on your hazard lights until safely on the freeway.
questions.answerD: Accelerate to the speed of freeway traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering a freeway, use the on-ramp to accelerate to the speed of freeway traffic so you can blend in smoothly and safely. Entering traffic must yield to traffic already on the freeway.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that drivers are approaching a steep hill and should prepare to adjust their speeds to continue to drive safely.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming curve in the road.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. Wherever this regulation sign is posted, U-turns are not permitted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that there is an upcoming stop sign and that they should prepare to come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. They should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid brake damage or collision.

questions.question: When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
questions.answerA: You have the right-of-way and do not need to check for trains.
questions.answerB: You may pass slower drivers while crossing the track.
questions.answerC: You need to make sure there is space for your vehicle to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
questions.explanation: If you are following another vehicle at a railroad crossing, check to make sure you have enough room to get all the way across before you drive onto the tracks. You should never try to pass another vehicle as you approach or cross a railroad crossing. Always check for trains before crossing any railroad tracks.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: You must bear either right or left.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a Y intersection ahead. You must bear either to the right or to the left.

questions.question: When is a driver permitted to turn right on a red traffic signal?
questions.answerA: When the driver has stopped and verified that the turn will not interfere with crossing traffic.
questions.answerB: When signs are clearly posted to allow a right turn on red.
questions.answerC: Only at the direction of a police officer.
questions.answerD: After first slowing and verifying the turn will not interfere with other traffic and pedestrians.
questions.explanation: In Ohio, it is legal to turn right after stopping at a red traffic signal, provided that a driver first comes to a complete stop and makes sure the turn will not interfere with crossing traffic or pedestrians. Drivers should only turn right on a red light when there is no sign posted forbidding right turns on red and they can clearly see that the turn can be completed safely.

questions.question: When two vehicles arrive to an intersection at the same time, which one has the right-of-way when no signs or signals indicate rules?
questions.answerA: The car approaching from the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The car approaching from the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: The car in which the driver sounds his horn first has the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: The car that is traveling the fastest has the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: At an intersection of two similar roads without a traffic control device, a driver must yield to a vehicle approaching from the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they may encounter traffic coming from the opposite direction.

questions.question: You may not park within ____ of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: Drivers should not park within 10 feet of a fire hydrant. Drivers should only park where it is legal to do so and where other drivers can clearly see their stopped vehicle.

questions.question: If someone has consumed alcoholic drinks, what will help the person overcome the influence of those drinks?
questions.explanation: Only the passage of time will allow a person to overcome the influence of alcohol.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: The highway ahead curves only to the right.
questions.answerB: The highway ahead turns sharply to the right.
questions.answerC: The highway ahead curves to the right and then to the left.
questions.answerD: The highway ahead curves to the left and then to the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the road ahead curves to the right and then to the left.

questions.question: If a driver sees an animal on the roadway:
questions.answerB: The driver should honk their horn.
questions.answerC: The driver should pass the animal as closely as possible.
questions.answerD: The driver should be very cautious.
questions.explanation: Be very cautious any time you encounter an animal on the roadway. Pass the animal slowly to avoid startling or frightening it.

questions.question: To prevent hydroplaning, you should:
questions.answerA: Ensure that your tires have good tread depth.
questions.answerB: Ensure that your tires are properly inflated.
questions.answerC: Reduce your speed when driving in the rain.
questions.explanation: To prevent hydroplaning, you should ensure that the tires on your vehicle have good tread depth and are inflated to the proper pressure. Reduce the speed of your vehicle when driving in the rain. Hydroplaning occurs most frequently at higher speeds.

questions.question: A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
questions.answerB: A person involved with a traffic study.
questions.explanation: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian when the pedestrian is a blind person who is using a white cane or guide dog.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. The road splits into two one-way roadways separated by a median or divider. You must keep to the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns drivers that the divided highway ends ahead.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid red arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular red traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Means that the traffic the arrow is pointing toward must stop.
questions.explanation: A solid red arrow in a traffic signal means the same thing as a circular red traffic light. When an arrow is red, traffic in the indicated lane must stop and may not turn in the direction that the arrow is pointing.

questions.question: You may not pass other vehicles within ____ of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: Drivers should not pass other vehicles within 100 feet of a railroad crossing. Drivers should only pass where it is safe and legal to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane ends or roadway narrows ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign warns drivers that the right lane is ending or that the road is narrowing ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited. Do not make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: A series of curves is ahead.
questions.answerD: The road will be slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that especially slippery conditions exist when the road is wet.

questions.question: Two solid white lines painted across a traffic lane show the boundaries of a crosswalk. As a driver, you should know that:
questions.answerA: Motor vehicles have the right-of-way over pedestrians in crosswalks.
questions.answerB: When pedestrians are in crosswalks, they should be given the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: No one has the right-of-way in a crosswalk.
questions.answerD: Pedestrians are responsible to stay out of the way of all traffic.
questions.explanation: Crosswalk lines show pedestrians where to safely cross a road or street. Crosswalks may be marked by horizontal lines, vertical lines, or a combination of the two. You must always stop for pedestrians who are in a crosswalk.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the overpass ahead has a low clearance. You should not proceed if your vehicle is taller than the height shown on the sign (in this case, 13 feet 6 inches).

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming traffic signal. They should be prepared to respond to a yellow light, red light, and/or cross traffic.

questions.question: At an intersection with a yield sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop before entering the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield just to the traffic on the right.
questions.answerC: Yield just to the traffic on the left.
questions.answerD: Slow down and yield the right-of-way to other traffic.
questions.explanation: A yield sign means that you must slow down and yield the right-of-way to traffic in the intersection or roadway you are entering.

questions.question: Certain highway signs contain information about hazardous conditions. Such signs are known as:
questions.explanation: Warning signs advise drivers of potentially hazardous conditions. For your own safety, obey warning signs. Disregarding the information provided by a warning sign may result in an accident due to your negligence.

questions.question: During normal weather and traffic conditions, keep a minimum following distance of:
questions.explanation: The more distance between your vehicle and others, the more time you have to react. Keep a minimum following distance of three seconds during normal weather and traffic conditions. Increase your following distance during unusual weather or traffic conditions.

questions.question: From the center lane, which maneuver(s) can you perform?
questions.explanation: This sign indicates where a lane is reserved for the exclusive use of left-turning vehicles from either direction. Such a lane may not be used for passing or for through-traffic.

questions.question: As you drive, you're required to stop your vehicle:
questions.answerA: At an intersection with a stop sign.
questions.answerB: Where there is a red light.
questions.answerC: When a traffic officer orders you to stop.
questions.explanation: Situations where motorists are required to stop include approaching intersections with stop signs, approaching intersections where a red light is either flashing or illuminated, or any time when a traffic officer orders your vehicle to stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign provides advance warning that bicycles may be present.

questions.question: Alcohol causes:
questions.explanation: Consuming even a small amount of alcohol will impair your vision, judgment, concentration, and coordination.

questions.question: In bad weather, increase your following distance to:
questions.explanation: The more distance between your vehicle and others, the more time you have to react to their actions. Keep a minimum following distance of four or five seconds during poor weather and traffic conditions.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign indicates that parking is not permitted.

questions.question: If you are approaching a school bus that has stopped to drop off children on a four-lane highway, you must come to a complete stop only if:
questions.answerA: You are traveling in the same direction as the bus.
questions.answerB: You can see children trying to cross the street.
questions.answerC: You are driving on the opposite side of the highway.
questions.answerD: The bus driver waves you ahead.
questions.explanation: If a school bus has stopped to drop off children on a roadway with four or more traffic lanes, only drivers on the same side of the roadway must come to a complete stop. Be especially cautious when driving near children.

questions.question: If traffic signals at an intersection are not functioning due to a power outage:
questions.answerA: Park your vehicle as far off the road as possible and wait for power to be restored.
questions.answerB: Use hand signals to indicate your intentions to other drivers.
questions.answerC: Turn on your hazard lights and proceed through the intersection without stopping.
questions.answerD: Treat the intersection as a four-way stop.
questions.explanation: If a traffic light at an intersection is not functioning due to a power outage, yield to other drivers in the same manner as you would when approaching a four-way stop. When it is your turn, proceed through the intersection with caution.

questions.question: If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
questions.answerA: Wait to proceed until you have a clear view of all tracks.
questions.answerB: Stop on the first railroad track and watch for another train.
questions.answerC: Go through as soon as the train passes.
questions.answerD: Go through when one of the tracks is free.
questions.explanation: If you are stopped at a railroad crossing with more than one track, do not start moving as soon as a train passes. Wait until you have a clear view down all tracks before you start across. Even where there is only one track, do not start across immediately after a train passes; check again for another train that may be approaching.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerD: There is a traffic signal ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a traffic signal ahead.

questions.question: In general, when driving, you should drive:
questions.answerA: Faster than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerB: On the right half of the road.
questions.answerC: Slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerD: On the left half of the road.
questions.explanation: Generally, when driving on a road with two lanes moving in the same direction, you should drive on the right half of the road. Use the left lane to overtake and pass another driver, to make a left turn, or if otherwise instructed to do so by an officer or traffic signal. Vehicles driving more slowly than the flow of traffic should stay in the rightmost lane.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns. Do not make a U-turn where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: Where is parking prohibited?
questions.explanation: Drivers should not park on top of a crosswalk, on a highway bridge, or in a tunnel. Drivers should only park where it is legal to do so and where other drivers can clearly see their stopped vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign means that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
questions.answerC: You may proceed if the way is clear.
questions.answerD: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.explanation: If you drive past these signs, you are going the wrong way and are at risk of a head-on collision. You should cautiously turn around.

questions.question: If you are driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you should:
questions.answerB: Pull off the right side of the road and let traffic pass.
questions.answerC: Not let the other cars pass your vehicle.
questions.explanation: Driving more slowly than the flow of traffic can be hazardous. If you are on a two-lane, two-way road and driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you are required to pull off the road and let the other vehicles pass. Only drive significantly under the speed limit when conditions require it.

questions.question: The driver's left arm and hand are extended downward. This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
questions.explanation: If a driver's left arm and hand are extended downward, they are indicating that they intend to stop. Adjust your driving accordingly if following a driver who is using this hand signal.

questions.question: This is a ____ sign.
questions.explanation: This triangular sign is a "Yield" sign. When you see this sign, you must slow down to check for traffic and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and approaching cross traffic. Stop only if it is necessary to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road is slippery when wet.

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on freeways with paved shoulders is:
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on freeways with paved shoulders is 65 mph. If a different speed limit is posted, you should follow that speed limit.

questions.question: Stress can affect your driving by:
questions.answerA: Lowing your ability to focus on driving.
questions.answerB: Decreasing your chances of an accident.
questions.answerC: Causing you to fall asleep at the wheel.
questions.answerD: Making you more aware of others around you.
questions.explanation: Emotions can have a great effect on your driving ability. You may not be able to drive well if you are overly worried, excited, afraid, angry, or sad. Stress can lessen your concentration on the task of driving. It is better to wait to drive than to risk driving while you are emotionally unstable.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that there is an upcoming sharp turn and that they should lower their speed accordingly.

questions.question: You should be cautious when passing a bicycle because:
questions.answerA: You are moving faster than the bicycle.
questions.answerB: The bicycle always has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Oncoming traffic may not see you pull out to pass the bicycle.
questions.answerD: The cyclist may have to swerve into traffic to avoid an object on the road.
questions.explanation: You should always be cautious when passing a bicycle because the cyclist may have to swerve into traffic to avoid an object on the road. Always be particularly careful when driving near bicyclists.

questions.question: To help relieve fatigue on a long trip, it is a good idea to:
questions.answerA: Stop and rest every two hours.
questions.answerC: Drive with one eye open at a time.
questions.answerD: Change feet on the gas pedal.
questions.explanation: To avoid becoming fatigued while taking a long trip, stop every two hours for a short break. If you become drowsy, pull off the road and park in a safe place to take a nap, or find a room to stay for the night.

questions.question: A driver license applicant under the age of ____ must have permission from their parent or legal guardian to apply for a driver license.
questions.explanation: If you are under the age of 18 and applying for an operator's license, your application must be co-signed by a parent or legal guardian.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Highway changes ahead and to the right.
questions.answerB: Hiking trails ahead and to the right.
questions.answerC: Hotel ahead and to the right.
questions.answerD: Hospital ahead and to the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that hospital emergency services are located to the right.
